meanings.definition: The state of not being identical.
meanings.sent1: The nonidentity of the twins was evident in their distinct personalities.
meanings.sent2: The nonidentity of the fingerprints helped solve the crime.
meanings.sent3: The nonidentity of the two snowflakes made them easy to tell apart.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of uniformity, her nonidentity shone like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The nonidentity of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to find the right match.

meanings.sent1: The nonidentity of the two cars made it easy to distinguish them.
meanings.sent2: The nonidentity of their tastes led to interesting food choices.
meanings.sent3: The nonidentity of the two dogs' barks made for a funny conversation.
meanings.sent4: In a world of copies, her nonidentity stood out like a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The nonidentity of the flowers in the garden created a beautiful mosaic of colors.

meanings.definition: The condition of being different or distinct.
meanings.sent1: The nonidentity of the two paintings was striking.
meanings.sent2: The nonidentity of their opinions sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent3: The nonidentity of the two clouds made them look like fluffy animals.
meanings.sent4: In a crowd of look-alikes, her nonidentity was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The nonidentity of the music genres blended into a unique harmony.
